IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Breast Screening Atypia and Subsequent Development of Cancer in England
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Breast Screening Atypia and Subsequent Development of Cancer: an Observational Analysis of the Sloane Database in England (Sloane Atypia Cohort Study)

Collaborator.CollaboratorName: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust
The Leeds Teaching Hospitals NHS Trust

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: During breast screening, atypical epithelial proliferations (atypia) can be detected. These are not cancer, but may mean that a woman is more likely to develop breast cancer in the future. This study explores how atypia develop into breast cancer in terms of number of women, time to cancer development, cancer type and severity, and whether this varies for different types of atypia. The results will be used to create new guidelines for how women with atypia should be followed up.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupLabel: Women attending Breast Cancer Screening in England with an atypia diagnosis
ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: Women attending Breast Cancer Screening in England with an atypia diagnosis between 1st January 2003 and 30th June 2018

ArmGroupInterventionName: Other: A diagnosis of atypia as part of the English screening programme

Intervention.InterventionName: A diagnosis of atypia as part of the English screening programme
Intervention.InterventionDescription: An atypia diagnosis of either ADH (including AIDEP), LISN (both ALH and LCIS) or FEA

InterventionArmGroupLabel: Women attending Breast Cancer Screening in England with an atypia diagnosis

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: Invasive breast cancer at 3 years following atypia diagnosis
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Invasive breast cancer rate at 3 years following atypia diagnosis (representing the first round of screening) for all atypia, by type of atypia, by level of management off atypia, by three 5-year periods (deviding study period into 2003 to 2007, 2008 to 2012 and 2013 to 2018), by location (ipsilateral, contralateral), by age group, and by complete vs incomplete reporting of atypia cases by screening centres
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Cumulative incidence of invasive breast cancer with all cause mortality as a competing risk at 3 years following atypia diagnosis

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: Invasive breast cancer at 6 years following atypia diagnosis
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Invasive breast cancer rate at 6 years following atypia diagnosis (representing the second round of screening) for all atypia, by type of atypia, by level of management off atypia, by three 5-year periods (deviding study period into 2003 to 2007, 2008 to 2012 and 2013 to 2018), by location (ipsilateral, contralateral), by age group, and by complete vs incomplete reporting of atypia cases by screening centres
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Cumulative incidence of invasive breast cancer with all cause mortality as a competing risk at 6 years following atypia diagnosis

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Invasive breast cancer at 1-year following atypia diagnosis
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Invasive breast cancer rate at 1-year following atypia diagnosis (representing likely missed cancers at screening) for all atypia, by type of atypia, by level of management of atypia, by three 5-year periods (deviding study period into 2003 to 2007, 2008 to 2012 and 2013 to 2018), by location (ipsilateral, contralateral), by age group, and by complete vs incomplete reporting of atypia cases by screening centres
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Cumulative incidence of invasive breast cancer with all cause mortality as a competing risk at 1-year following atypia diagnosis

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Invasive cancer or non-invasive cancer (Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)) at 1 year following atypia diagnosis
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Rate of invasive breast cancer or DCIS at 1 year following atypia diagnosis for all atypia and by type and location of atypia
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Cumulative incidence of invasive breast cancer or DCIS with all cause mortality as a competing risk at 1 year following atypia diagnosis

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Invasive cancer or non-invasive cancer (Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)) at 3 years following atypia diagnosis
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Rate of invasive breast cancer or DCIS at 3 years following atypia diagnosis for all atypia and by type and location of atypia
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Cumulative incidence of invasive breast cancer or DCIS with all cause mortality as a competing risk at 3 years following atypia diagnosis

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Invasive cancer or non-invasive cancer (Ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS)) at 6 years following atypia diagnosis
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Rate of invasive breast cancer or DCIS at 6 years following atypia diagnosis for all atypia and by type and location of atypia
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Cumulative incidence of invasive breast cancer or DCIS with all cause mortality as a competing risk at 6 years following atypia diagnosis

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Diagnosis of epithelial atypia (ADH (including AIDEP), LISN (both ALH and LCIS) and FEA) in the Sloane database between 1st January 2003 and 30th June 2018

Exclusion Criteria:

bilateral primary cases
the "best prognosis" atypia of the bilateral primaries
atypia with co-existing DCIS
pleomorphic LCIS (as these are managed akin to DCIS)
unknown type of atypia
cases not from England
patients without follow-up until 31 December 2018
EligibilityModule.StudyPopulation: Women with atypia diagnosed during breast cancer screening in England between 1st January 2003 and 30th June 2018.

IPDSharingStatementModule.IPDSharingDescription: The investigators do not have Office for Data Release permissions to share these data more widely, but can assist other researchers in applying for access.
